title: No user assistance help message on the Quarkus docs landing page search when there are zero results
body:
### Describe the bug

When you search for documentation by using the search box on the [Quarkus docs landing page for 3.0](https://quarkus.io/guides/) and there are zero matches, the user assistance help message and content links to guide the reader no longer displays.




### Expected behavior

A message to advise the user with further resources including a link to the handy Quarkus cheat sheet and other links.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/237023252-b6e038b6-10e4-4cd0-83fb-1aca9be5d4a6.png)

### Actual behavior

Search results in 3.0 (and main snapshot):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/237022837-086aec45-4325-4c35-bcfd-7d53f713eadc.png)

This 'silent' usability behavior kinda gives the impression that the search has paused or the feature is broken.


### How to Reproduce?


1. Go to https://quarkus.io/guides/.
2. In the search box, enter `postgresql`. 
3. Press Enter to start the search.
RESULT: Zero results and no message as per screen capture :arrow_up: .

Do the same search in 2.13 or 2.7 docs and the user assistance features are displayed as expected.


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

Also, a result of zero matches for a doc search on the keyword `postgresql` is not correct. There are many docs that contain this key word. Google search yields many.

This is a separate bug/limitation of the search indexing/results in the Quarkus doc portal.
